pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.6: According to _bhikkhu-pācittiya_ 69, “community”, _saṁvāsa_, refers to formal meetings of the community, see [Bu Pc 69:2.1.21](pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.21). The present rule refers to formal meetings where both _bhikkhus_ and _bhikkhunīs_ are present.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.2: [Sp.2.693]() defines _pakkhasaṅkantā_ as joining another religion: _Pakkhasaṅkantā vāti titthāyatanaṃ saṅkantā_, “_Pakkhasaṅkantā vā_ means one who has joined the ascetics of another religion.” Yet the idea of _pakkha_ also refers to groups or factions within the Sangha, for instance, when the Sangha is split into different communities (_nānāsaṁvāsa_) that no longer perform legal procedures together.
